docs.snippet: Contains several chapters in continuation of SHIRLEY BROOKES' brilliant Story, THE SILVER CORD, with other literary matter of interest.
docs.lead_paragraph: Contains several chapters in continuation of SHIRLEY BROOKES' brilliant Story, THE SILVER CORD, with other literary matter of interest.

headline.main: NATIONAL AFFAIRS.; IMPORTANT FOREIGN APPOINTMENTS. Charles Francis Adams Minister to England. William L. Dayton Minister to France. George P. Marsh Minister to Sardinia. Speech of Mr. Breckinridge in the Senate. He Interprets the Inaugural as Meaning War.LATEST DISPATCHES FROM THE SOUTH.Surrender of the Ringgold Barraoks in Texas. OUR WASHINGTON DISPATCHES. IMPORTANT FOREIGN APPOINTMENTS. THE MEXICAN MISSION. MINISTER TO GUATEMALA. IMPORTANCE OF ACTION BY THE SENATE. THE CALIFORNIA APPOINTMENTS. TAKING THE RESPONSIBILITY. OFFICE-SEEKERS WARNED OFF. RESIGNATIONS. MILITARY MOVEMENTS IN TEXAS. KEEP THE FEDERAL TROOPS IN THE FIELD. THE TEXAN VOLUNTEERS.

NATIONAL AFFAIRS.; HIGHLY IMPORTANT FROM WASHINGTON. Doubts about the Withdrawal of the Troops from Sumpter. No Order Issued for the Evacuation. Opinions of the Southern Commissioners.Latest News Relative to Appointments. ADJOURNMENT OF THE SOUTHERN CONGRESS, Departure of the Federal Troops from Texas.Refusal of the Louisiana Convention toSubmit the New Constitutionto the People.OUR WASHINGTON DISPATCHES. CONCERNING FORT SUMPTER. FAREWELL OF MR. AND MRS. CRITTENDEN. A GROUNDLESS GROWL. CONFIRMATION AND APPOINTMENTS. GEN. SPINNER CONFIRMED. THE PROPOSITION OF SENATOR DOUGLAS. THE OHIO SENATORIAL CONTEST. INDIVIDUAL ITEMS.

NATIONAL AFFAIRS.; INTERESTING FROM THE FEDERAL CAPITAL Gen. Scott and Col. Totten at a Special Meeting of the Cabinet. EXCITING SCENE IN THE SENATE. Mr. Douglas Mounts a High Horse and Descends Again. The Proposed Inquiry Relative to the Southern Forts. The Office-Seekers and the Appointments. MORE FORTIFICATIONS IN SOUTH CAROLINA. Proceedings of the Virginia and Other State Conventions, OUR WASHINGTON DISPATCHES. MEETING OF THE CABINET. SENATOR JOHNSON'S POLICY. THE SARDINIAN MISSION. REPRESENTATION OF THE COUNTRY ABROAD. DISTRIBUTING THE SPOILS. OFFICE SEEKING IN THE SOUTHERN CONFEDERACY. VERBAL SET-TO BETWEEN DOUGLAS AND FESSENDEN. THE PUBLIC PRINTING OFFICE. THE OHIO SENATORSHIP. THE CALIFORNIA SENATORIAL ELECTION. BURLINGAME AGAIN FOR CONGRESS. DISPATCH TO THE ASSOCIATED PRESS. Dispatch to the Baltimore American.

docs.snippet: The annals of litigation furnish no two more interesting or peculiar cases than those of Madame PATERSON BONAPARTE, and of Mrs. MYRA CLARK GAINES, both of which have, for many years, occupied prominent positions before, not only the legal profession,...
docs.lead_paragraph: The annals of litigation furnish no two more interesting or peculiar cases than those of Madame PATERSON BONAPARTE, and of Mrs. MYRA CLARK GAINES, both of which have, for many years, occupied prominent positions before, not only the legal profession, but the eyes of the world. These cases are singularly suggestive, and peculiarly illustrative of certain phases of American society, and as such,...

docs.snippet: The steamship De Soto, Capt. JOHNSON, from New-Orleans March 6, calling at Havana on the 9th, arrived here yesterday morning.

headline.main: FROM HAVANA.; Arrival of the De Soto Business and the Markets The Monetary Crisis Shameful Frauds by the Banks Arrival of Signora Miramon More Slaves Landed From Yucatan.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship De Soto, Capt. JOHNSON, from New-Orleans March 6, calling at Havana on the 9th, arrived here yesterday morning.

headline.main: THE RECEPTION OF GEN. DIX.; Address of Mayor Wood and Response of Gen. Dix.Testimonial from Distinguished Citizens He Declines a Public Dinner.
